alert.note: Alert for Alger; Luce; Northern Schoolcraft; Southern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 6:20AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Luce, northeastern Schoolcraft and northeastern Alger Counties through 700 AM EDT... At 619 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles northwest of Grand Marais to near Seney to 11 miles southeast of Manistique. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Germfask and Seney around 625 AM EDT. McMillan around 635 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Newberry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized ponding on roads. Slow down when driving on wet pavement. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass.

area.areaDesc: Alger; Luce; Northern Schoolcraft; Southern Schoolcraft
